page.title: 02NATLAND VILLAGE CHURCH.
page.content: { St. Mark's Church}stands opposite the village green. It is the fourth church to stand on this site. The foundation stone was laid by{William Crewdson}on 29th of June 1909, which makes the church seventy-five this year. On Friday 9th of October 1981{the Bishop {of Carlisle}opened{the extension}which includes a vestry, kitchen and office. Many of{the valuable items,}such as Communion sets, were donated; one goblet is inscribed 'Natland Chapel 1821'.{The pulpit}was a gift too, from J. Swindlehurst of Helme Bank, in loving memory of his wife, who died in 1906. The Vicar, Rev. Park uses 'Vino Sacro' as{Communion wine. The church is made of sandstone and costs Â£3,000 a year for heating and lighting. In 1909{the organ}cost Â£25,000. Mr. Blenkarn winds{the clock once a week.
